office: The Energy and Commerce Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: planning and executing member, staff and stakeholder meetings on issues before the committee
collaborating with policy staff to plan and organize Democratic Committee Forums
drafting and circulating notifications and communications so members, staff and external organizations are aware of the Committee’s actions
handling other administrative tasks for the Committee
requirements: proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks

office: Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard’s Oahu district office
key_responsibilities: fielding constituent calls
processing mail
coordinating internship program
assisting with casework and constituent requests for information
maintaining a photographic database
drafting correspondence
maintaining office equipment
other administrative duties
occasionally representing Congresswoman Gabbard at community events

office: The office of Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard
position: Military and Veterans Liaison and Caseworker
key_responsibilities: helping constituents resolve issues and navigate the services provided by the federal government
managing constituent casework
participating in community projects and events
monitoring and updating the Congresswoman and Chief of Staff on district and local issues

acting as a liaison to federal and local agencies for the Congresswoman for the following issue areas: Department of Defense/Military, Homeland Security (Military-related) including U.S. Coast Guard, Intelligence, Veterans, Foreign Affairs, FAA, and FEMA/Disaster Management
requirements: capacity to produce quality work on short deadlines
demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with colleagues in a dynamic work environment
ability to pay close attention to detail
ability to think creatively to find solutions

office: New Mexico Democrat and CHC Chairwoman
key_responsibilities: maintaining the Member’s daily and long-term schedules
processing all incoming invitations and meeting requests
coordinating travel arrangements
communicating with constituents by phone and email to address requests, concerns, and questions
driving the member (including nights and some weekends)
greeting visitors
answering phones
opening the office
general assistance to the DC office staff
backing up the Staff Assistant
assisting office with administrative duties
requirements: previous scheduling experience (at least one year in a similar position)

key_responsibilities: coordinating the Member’s legislative agenda (with the LD)
overseeing health and other issues that fit with the applicants skills and interest
requirements: at least three years’ legislative experience on Capitol Hill
knowledge of health care systems and laws

key_responsibilities: leading an aggressive national communications operation
creating and executing media plans
confirming national cable TV interviews
frequent pitching and reporter/producer engagement
social media platform management
drafting op-eds, releases and press materials
handling a portfolio including commerce, trade, labor, and other issues as assigned
advancing legislation
analyzing and briefing on complex policy issues
drafting a wide array of written materials
requirements: prior experience as a Legislative Assistant or otherwise managing commerce, trade, and labor policy
strong written and verbal communication skills
demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
at least three years of Hill or other relevant professional experience

key_responsibilities: acting as the representative for the Congressman answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, verbal communications with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies
handling casework assignments
acting as a liaison to local, state and federal officials and other persons or groups to form effective relationships for the Congressman
assessing casework for problems requiring legislative action and making recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
screening and referring cases, when appropriate, to other district offices
logging in all incoming telephone calls relating to casework
preparing periodic reports for the District Director on pending cases and district activities in his or her assigned issue areas
continually screening active cases and acting as liaison with constituents to ensure that their cases are handled in a responsive manner
maintaining up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information of importance to the office
meeting attendance requirements as established by the office
maintaining a good working relationship with the Congressman, staff, and constituents
accepting performance-based criticism and direction
working well under pressure and handling stress
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: strong written, communication, analytical, and organization skills
ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds
good computer skills, including proficiency and experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
understanding of government agencies and structure (local, county, state and federal)
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
ability to meet strict deadlines and balance multiple projects
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

office: The Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: depositions
transcribed interviews
briefings
congressional hearings
requirements: junior attorney (fewer than five years of experience)
background or strong interest in investigations
ability to work well under pressure
excellent written and oral communication skills
